alert.note: Alert for Mercer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:47PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Smyth, eastern Tazewell, western Bland, northwestern Wythe and southwestern Mercer Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tiptop, or near Tazewell, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bluefield... Tazewell... Rural Retreat... Ceres... Burkes Garden... Pocahontas... and Nebo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
